Military Record for John J. Moran, March 8, 1919

div1.p: This record concerns Moran's assignments in France with the Quartermaster Corps, his return to the United States, and his honorable discharge.

div1.head: Military Record for John J. Moran, March 8, 1919
div1.opener:
H E A D Q U A R T E R S
HOSPITAL CENTER
A P O 780
Am.E.F.
March 8, 1919.
SPECIAL ORDERS:
No. 67.
div1.p:
9. Under the provisions of G.O. 14, HAEF., c.s.
Captain John J. Moran, QMC., is hereby granted three (3) days
leave in Bordeaux, Gironde (travel time excluded).
div1.closer:
By order of Colonel Skinner: Newton A. Seaborn,
Major, M.C.
Adjutant. ASSISTANT PROVOST MARSHALL
A.E.F.
No 38

div1.head: Letter from JOHN F. McCLOSKEY, June 20, 1919
div1.opener:
CENTRAL RECORDS OFFICE
HEADQUARTERS UNITED STATES TROOPS
AMERICAN EXPEDITIONARY FORCES
Bourges (Cher) France
June 20th, 1919.
SPECIAL ORDER
NO. 171.
E X T R A C T
div1.p:
51. Captain J. J. Moran, QHC, and Rogt. Sgt. Maj. Claude H. Dickert:
#1344124, accompanied by Cpl. Jacob Wolfe, #2695992 (chauffeur) driving Car No.
112295, on duty at this station, will proceed to Paris on official business, and
upon completion of duties will return to this station.

The Quartermaster Corps will pay Sgt. Maj. Dickert and Cpl. Wolfe
commutation of rations at the authorized rate for the required number of days
while on this duty, it being impracticable for them to carry rations in kind.
Travel by automobile is authorized.
The journey directed is necessary in the public service.
div1.closer:
By order of COLONEL STONE: JOHN F. McCLOSKEY,
1st Lieut., Inf.,
Adjt. U.S. Troops. E
Copy to: File
Pers. Adjt.
QMC

div1.head: Letter from R. T. TAYLOR, July 21, 1919
div1.opener:
CENTRAL RECORDS OFFICE
HEADQUARTERS UNITED STATES TROOPS
AMERICAN EXPEDITIONARY FORCES
Bourges (Cher) France
July 21st, 1919.
SPECIAL ORDERS
No. 202
E X T R A C T
div1.p:
33. Major H. Sorensen, Q.M.C. and Captain J. J. Moran, Q.M.C.,
accompanied by Corporal Frank Manning, #2585822, M.T.C.6540, driving
Cadillac #15192, will proceed to Eontiorechance and thence to Giovre on
Official business. Upon completion of this duty they will return to
this station.

The Quartermaster Corps will pay commutation of rations at
the prescribed rate for the necessary number of days while on this duty, to
the above named enlisted men, it being impracticable to carry rations of any
kind.
Travel by motor vehicle is authorized.
The travel directed is necessary in the military service.
div1.closer:
BY ORDER OF COLONEL STONE: R. T. TAYLOR,
Major, Infantry
Adjutant Copy to: File
Pers. Adjt.
M.T.C. $540

div1.head: Letter from R. T. TAYLOR
div1.opener:
CENTRAL RECORDS OFFICE
HEADQUARTERS UNITED STATES TROOPS
AMERICAN EXPEDITIONARY FORCES
Bourges (Cher) France
August 1st, 1919.
SPECIAL ORDERS
NO. 213.
E X T R A C T
div1.p:
36. Under the provisions contained in par. 2, GO #14, GHQ, 1919;
Captain J. J. Moran, QMC, on duty at this station, is granted a class C leave
of absence for three (3) days, time of travel not included, with permission
to visit Paris (Seine), France, effective August 3rd, 1919.
“Armee Americaine Permissionaire Quart-de-Tarif.”
div1.closer:
By order of Colonel Stone: R. T. TAYLOR,
Major, Infantry
Adjt, U.S. Troops. HEADQUARTERS
U.S. TROOPS.
BOURGES
OFFICIAL
E
Copy to: File
Pers. Adjt.
CRO

div1.head: Letter from R. T. TAYLOR, AUGUST 1, 1919
div1.opener:
CORRECTED COPY
CENTRAL RECORDS OFFICE
HEADQUARTERS UNITED STATES TROOPS
AMERICAN EXPEDITIONARY FORCES
Bourges (Cher) France
August 1st, 1919.
SPECIAL ORDERS
No. 213.
E X T R A C T
div1.p:
35. Pursuant to authority contained in Sub-paragraph a, Section #5,
G.O. #29, GH., R.E.F., and under the provisions of Bulletin #45, Hdqrs. Inter.
Sec., S.O.S., dated June 20th, 1919, Captain J. J. Moran, Q.H.C., accompanied
by Q.M. Sgt. F. A. Weiland, #702321, Q.M.C., and Chauffeur Cpl. Frank Manning,
#1565822, M.T.C. #840, driving Cadillac #15191, will proceed to Mars, Hospital
Center and thence to Nevers, for the purpose of paying troops at those stations.
Upon completion of this duty they will return to this station.

The Quartermaster Corps will pay the above named enlisted men
commutation of rations at the prescribed rate for the necessary number of days
while on the duty, it being impracticable to carry rations of any kind.
Travel by automobile is authorized.
The travel directed is necessary in the military service.
div1.closer:
BY COMM. OF COLONEL STONE: R. T. TAYLOR,
Major, Infantry
Adjutant HEADQUARTERS
U.S.TROOPS
OFFICIAL
Copy to: File
Pers. Adjt.
QEC
M.T.C. $540
Gds

div1.head: Letter from R.T. TAYLOR, August 7, 1919
div1.opener:
CENTRAL RECORDS OFFICE
HEADQUARTERS UNITED STATES TROOPS
AMERICAN EXPEDITIONARY FORCES
Bourges (Cher) France
August 7th, 1919.
SPECIAL ORDERS
No. 219.
E X T R A C T
div1.p:
15. S.O. #171, Par. #41, c.s., those Headquarters, dated June 30th,
1919, is amended to read as follows: Pursuant to authority contained in
Sub-paragraph B, Section #5, G.O. #29, GRQ., 1919. Captain J. J. Moran, Q.M.C.,
and Regtl. Sgt. Maj. Claude H. Dickert, #1334124, accompanied by Cpl. Jacob
Wolfe #2685384, (Chauffeur) driving Car No. 112285, on duty at this station,
will proceed to Paris, on official business and upon completion of same will
return to this station.

The Quartermaster Corps will pay the above named enlisted men
commutation of rations at the prescribed rate for the necessary number of days
while on this duty, it being impracticable to carry rations of any kind.
Travel by automobile is authorized.
The travel directed is necessary in the military service.
div1.closer:
BY ORDER OF COLONEL STONE: R. T. TAYLOR
Major, Infantry
Adjutant HEADQUARTERS
U.S. TROOPS
BOURGES
OFFICIAL
Copy to: File
Pers. Adjt.
QMC
gds

div1.head: Letter from R. T. TAYLOR, August 14, 1919
div1.opener:
CENTRAL RECORDS OFFICE
HEADQUARTERS UNITED STATES TROOPS
AMERICAN EXPEDITIONARY FORCES
Bourges (Cher) France
August 14th, 1919.
SPECIAL ORDERS
No. 326.
E X T R A C T
div1.p:
14. Pursuant to authority contained in sub-paragraph E, Section #5,
C.O.F.S. QH., A.E.F., Captain J. J. Moran, Q.M.C., accompanied by Corporal
David N. Reid, #3202623, M.T.C. #540, driving Cadillac Car #18789, will proceed
to Nevers, for the purpose of paying French Civilian Employee. Upon completion
of this duty they will return to this station.

The Quartermaster Corps will pay the above named enlisted men
commutation of rations at the prescribed rate for the necessary number of
days while on this duty, it being impracticable to carry rations of any kind.
Travel by automobile is authorized.
The travel directed is necessary in the military service.
div1.closer:
BY ORDER OF COLONEL STONE: R. T. TAYLOR
Major HEADQUARTERS
U.S. TROOPS
BOURGES
Copy to: File
Pers. Adjt.
Q.M.C.
M.T.C.
ds

div1.head: Letter from R. T. TAYLOR, August 21, 1919
div1.opener:
CENTRAL RECORDS OFFICE
HEADQUARTERS UNITED STATES TROOPS
AMERICAN EXPEDITIONARY FORCES
Bourges (Cher) France
August 21st, 1919.
SPECIAL ORDERS
No. 233.
E X T R A C T
div1.p:
5. Pursuant to authority contained in sub-paragraph E, Section
#5, G.C. #39, QH., A.E.F., 1919, Major , Sorensen, R. U. Captain
J. J. Moran, Q.H.C., and 1st Lieut. Oman Halle, A.G.C., will proceed to
Ciavres, accompanied by Chauffeur Pvt. Leah Johnson, #783275, M.T.C.,
driving Cadillac #15848, an official business in connection with the
Central Records Office. Upon completion of this duty will return
to their proper station.

The Quartermaster Corps will pay the above named enlisted
men commutation of rations at the prescribed rate for the necessary number
of days while on this duty, it being impracticable to carry rations of any
kind.
Travel by automobile is authorized.
The travel directed is necessary in the military service.
div1.closer:
BY ORDER OF COLONEL STONE: R. T. TAYLOR,
Major, Infantry
Adjutant HEADQUARTERS
U.S. TROOPS
BURGEOUS
OFFICIAL
Copy to: File
Pers. Adjt.
M.T.C.
Q.M.C.

div1.head: Letter from R. T. TAYLOR, August 22, 1919
div1.opener:
CENTRAL RECORDS OFFICE
HEADQUARTERS UNITED STATES TROOPS
AMERICAN EXPEDITIONARY FORCES
Bourges (Cher) France
August 22, 1919.
SPECIAL ORDERS
No. 234.
E X T R A C T
div1.p:
12. Pursuant to authority contained in sub-paragraph E,
Section #5, G.O. #29, GHQ., A.E.F., 1919, Captain J.J. Moran, Q.M.C.
and 1st Lieut. J.S. Peters, Cav., will proceed to Gievros, accompanied
by Chauffeur Corporal David R. Reid, #3372625, M.T.C., driving
Cadillac Car #18789, on official business in connection with the
Central Records Office. Upon completion of this duty they will return
to their proper station.

The Quartermaster Corps will pay the above named
enlisted men commutation of rations at the prescribed rate for the
necessary number of days while on this duty, it being impracticable
to carry rations of any kind.
Travel by automobile is authorized.

The travel directed is necessary in the military
service.
div1.closer:
BY ORDER OF COLONEL STONE: R. T. TAYLOR,
Major, Infantry
Adjutant. HEADQUARTERS
U.S. TROOPS,
BOURGES

div1.head: Letter from R. T. TAYLOR, August 24, 1919
div1.opener:
CENTRAL RECORDS OFFICE
HEADQUARTERS UNITED STATES TROOPS
AMERICAN EXPEDITIONARY FORCES
Bourges (Cher) France
August 24th, 1919.
SPECIAL ORDERS
NO. 236.
E X T R A C T
div1.p:
2. Pursuant to authority contained in sub-paragraph E, Section
#5, G.O. #29, GHQ., A.B.F., 1919, Captain J.J. Moran, Q.M.C., accompanied
by Chauffeur Corporal David Reed, #3372625, driving Cadillac Car #18789,
will proceed to Tours on official business in connection with the Central
Records Office. Upon completion of this duty they will return to their
proper station.

The Quartermaster Corps will pay the above named enlisted
men commutation of rations at the prescribed rate for the necessary
number of days while on this duty, it being impracticable to carry rations
of any kind.
Travel by automobile is authorized.

The travel directed is necessary in the military
service.
div1.closer:
BY ORDER OF COLONEL STONE: R. T. TAYLOR,
Major, Infantry
Adjutant. HEADQUARTERS
U.S. TROOPS
BOURGES
OFFICIAL

div1.head: Letter from R.P. HARBOLD, August 27, 1919
div1.opener:
CENTRAL RECORDS OFFICE
HEADQUARTERS UNITED STATES TROOPS
AMERICAN EXPEDITIONARY FORCES
Bourges (Cher) France
August 27, 1919.
memorandum for Adjutant General, S.O.S.:
div1.p:
Captain J.J. Moran, Q.M.C., having completed his
duties at this post has been directed to report for fur-
ther instructions. It was the intention of this office
to grant Captain Moran a class “B” leave, but due to the
great amount of work incident to the closing of this post
it was found impossible to do this. It is requested that
such consideration as is consistent with the present pol-
icy relative to leaves be shown this officer.
div1.closer:
R.P. HARBOLD,
Lt. Colonel, I.G.D.,
Commanding. A true copy
Col. G.S.

div1.head: Letter from T. R. TAYLOR, August 27, 1919
div1.opener:
CENTRAL RECORDS OFFICE
HEADQUARTERS UNITED STATES TROOPS
AMERICAN EXPEDITIONARY FORCES
Bourges (Cher) France
August 27th, 1919.
SPECIAL ORDERS
NO. 239.
E X T R A C T
div1.p:
4. Under the provisions of sub-paragraph E, Section #5, G.O.
#29, G.H.Q., A.E.F., Captain J.J. Moran, Q.R.C. will proceed to Paris on
official business in connection with the Central Records Office, reporting
upon arrival thereat to the Chief Quartermaster. Upon completion of this
duty he will report to the Commanding General, M.O.C., for further
instructions.
The travel directed is necessary in the military service.
div1.closer:
BY ORDER OF COLONEL STONE: R. T. TAYLOR,
Major, Infantry
Adjutant. HEADQUARTERS
U.S. TROOPS
BOURGES
Copy to:-File
Pers.Adjt.
Q.M.C.
haq

div1.head: Letter from JAS. H. LAUBACH, August 28, 1919
div1.opener:
AMERICAN EXPEDITIONARY FORCES,
OFFICE OF THE CHIEF QUARTERMASTER.
A.P.O.#702
August 28th, 1919.
MEMORANDUM.
div1.p:
1. Captain J.J. Moran, Q.M.C. has completed his duties with
the C.Q.M., and is reporting to the Commanding General, S.O.S. for
further instructions, as directed by S.O. #239, Hqrs, Central
Records Office, A.E.F.
div1.closer:
JAS.H.LAUBACH,
Lieut. Colonel, Q.M. Corps.
Chief, Personnel Division.

div1.head: Letter from E.E. BOOTH, August 30, 1919
div1.opener:
AMERICAN EXPEDITIONARY FORCES
HEADQUARTERS SERVICES OF SUPPLY
August 30, 1919.
N.B.
Special Orders.
No.
242.
Extract
div1.p: x x x x x

Par. Under provisions of General Orders No. 14, c.s., G.H.Q.,
A.E.F., Class “D” leave of absence for ten (10) days, inclusive of
travel time, effective August 29, 1919, is granted Captain J.J. Moran,
Q.M.C., with permission to visit points in France, west of north
and south line through Rheims.

Upon expiration of leave, Captain Moran will proceed to
Brest, reporting upon arrival to the Commanding General, Brest, on
or before September 9th, 1919, for return to the United States.
ARMEE AMERICAINE PERMISSIONAIRE QUART DE TARIF.

3-Capt.Moran.(Thru C.Q.M.)
1-C.Q.M.)
1-C.G.Brest.
1-Pers.A.G.O.
1-Records with corres.
x x x x x
div1.closer:
By Command of Brigadier General Connor: E. E. BOOTH,
Chief of Staff. Official:
HARRISON HALL,
Adjutant General.
